text: The Barelvi movement (Urdu: بَرَلَوِیْ جَمَاَعَتْ) also known as Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat is a revivalist movement in the Sunni Islam in South Asia. It is influenced by Sufism and named after Ahmed Raza Khan Barelvi, a Hanafi Islamic scholar from Bareilly district of Uttar Pradesh. People connected with the movement follows Hanafi and Shafi’i schools of jurisprudence and Maturidi and Ash’ari school of theology. == Beliefs == Barlevis believe in the calling upon saints and prophets for help. They also believe that the Prophet Muhammad was made out of light (in a literal sense). Barlevis also make takfir on large groups of people who disagree with their ideals. == Notable scholars == * Hamid Raza Khan * Mustafa Raza Khan Qadri * Ibrahim Raza Khan * Akhtar Raza Khan * Asjad Raza Khan * Abdul Hamid Qadri Badayuni * Ahmad Saeed Kazmi == References == Category:Islam in India Category:Islam in Pakistan Category:Islam in Bangladesh Category:Barelvi movement
